"Memorandum "by the Minister of Information. 'I was instructed by the War Cabinet at their Meeting onJuly 26th to submit a scheme for the further examination of the ideasoutlined in my paper (WP (40) 275) on Propaganda for the Future.I have discussed, this matter with the Lord Privy Seal andthe Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, and now suggest that aCommittee of Ministers should be set ux^ to examine the subject andreport to the Cabinet. ' The three political parties should berepresented on the Committee, and I suggest therefore that it should consist of the Lord President of the Council, the Lord Privy Seal, theSecretary of State for Air, the Secretary of. State for Foreign Affairs,the ilinister of Labour, and myself,In order that its terms of reference may not be too wide, i suggest that the Committee be invited to explore first the possibilityof setting up some post-war International System, based upon theprinciple of federation, and secondly a scheme of social reform forthe United Kingdom, with particular reference to unemployment, education and housing.D. 0.19th August, 1940.
